intro: Carissophyllum longiflorum, commonly known as the long-flowered carissa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, glossy dark green leaves, and clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
